default: (a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
a mask and cape with a design of your choosing.

fluff.name: Empowered
entries: Человек в маске получает одну стрелу в грудь. Затем еще одну. Несмотря на то, что его бьют, он просто не падает. Вдруг он прыгает в сторону нападавшего и взлетает, оставляя на месте, где он стоял, кратер. Схватив противника, он поднимает его и швыряет в ближайшую стену. Он подбирает лук бандита и переламывает его пополам, а затем поворачивается, чтобы поприветствовать своих поклонников.

Когда гоблины уже собираются уходить, они видят, как кто-то выходит прямо из горящей деревни: эльф, чья кожа объята багровым пламенем. Последнее, что видят гоблины, - это инферно, расцветающее из ее руки.

В мгновение ока тифлинг проносится мимо стражников, в башню и прокладывает себе путь через подземелье. Пленник едва успевает осознать, что его спасают, прежде чем оказывается за стенами замка. Трифлинг останавливается на мгновение, чтобы перевести дыхание, а затем мчится обратно, быстрее, чем может видеть глаз.
Куда бы они ни отправились, наделенный властью человек всегда будет пытаться изменить мир. Иногда это происходит к лучшему, иногда... не очень.

entries.name: With Great Power...
entries: В отличие от колдунов, наделенные силой существа не были одарены мастерством магии. Вместо этого они наделены сверхъестественной силой. Они могут бить кулаками с весом всего мира за спиной, сокрушать валуны и часто способны к естественному полету.

Бывают случаи, когда способности наделенного силой могут показаться сродни магическим, но это заблуждение. Арканные способности, которыми они обладают, встроены непосредственно в их физиологию. Если наделенный способностями может вызывать молнию кончиками пальцев, вскрытие, скорее всего, обнаружит значительные мутации в руках наделенного способностями.

entries.name: ...Comes Great Responsibility
entries: Эти способности растут и развиваются так, что наделенные ими могут не понимать их в полной мере. Поскольку ни одно из двух наделенных силой существ не похоже на другое по своим способностям, ни один человек не способен направлять их. Врожденное отличие от остальных сородичей дает наделенному силой возможность стать героем, но может привести и к злодейской жизни.

entries.name: Creating an Empowered
entries: Ключ к созданию наделенного силой человека - выяснение истории его происхождения. Где вы получили свои способности? Сплавился ли с вами инопланетный кристалл после аварийной посадки на вашу планету? Внепланетная сущность выбрала вас своим защитником?

Следующий важный шаг - определить, как ваш наделенный силой отреагировал на свои способности. У наделенного силой может быть практически любая предыстория или соответствие, в зависимости от того, как он стал тем, кем является сейчас. Были ли у них способности с рождения? Они открыли их в себе на прошлой неделе? Скрывают ли они свои способности или упиваются ими?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: Вы можете быстро создать силу, следуя следующим рекомендациям. Во-первых, поместите свой наивысший балл способностей в Силу, а следующий наивысший - в Конституцию. Во-вторых, выберите фон {@background folk hero}.

entries.name: Suggested Characteristics
entries: Наделенные силой существа могут быть очень разными в зависимости от их взглядов на жизнь. Некоторые из них альтруисты, некоторые эгоисты, а другие морально неоднозначны.

rows: Я отпускаю плохие шутки во время драк, чтобы справиться со своим страхом.
Я никогда не использую ненормативную лексику, как бы я ни был зол.
Я не испытываю симпатии к преступникам, независимо от того, украли они чью-то жизнь или буханку хлеба.
Я получаю огромное удовольствие от известности, богатства и славы, которые приходят с героем.
Я провожу ночи в задумчивости на крышах.
Я пытаюсь все исправить, но в итоге ломаю еще больше.
Я бы хотел, чтобы у меня никогда не было моих способностей. Они - проклятие.
Я не думаю, что кто-то не может быть искуплен.
**Справедливость.** Я выслежу всех преступников до последнего. (Законный)
**Свобода.** Я выступаю против угнетения во всех его формах. (Хаотично)
**Мораль.** Я убиваю только в крайнем случае. (Хорошо)
**Месть.** Наконец-то я могу противостоять тем, кто обидел меня. Я планирую отомстить. (Зло)
**Мир.** При всей моей силе, кажется, что все становится только хуже, когда я вмешиваюсь. (Нейтрально)
**Мастерство.** Мои способности уникальны. Важно, чтобы я разгадал тайну их действия. (Любой)
Мой единственный друг - мой верный семейный дворецкий.
Я охочусь на другого уполномоченного: старого соперника, который когда-то был моим другом детства.
Я объединился с несколькими другими наделенными силой существами, чтобы помочь друг другу обрести контроль над нашими способностями.
Я взял в свои подопечные молодого человека, наделенного полномочиями. Я делаю все возможное, чтобы помочь им учиться на моих ошибках.
Днем меня наняли для охоты на печально известного мстителя. Ночью я и есть этот мститель.
Я случайно причинил кому-то вред, когда открыл свои способности, и теперь меня разыскивают за это.
Я не могу контролировать свой характер.
Держа свои способности в секрете, я отдаляю тех, кого люблю.
Иногда я позволяю своей силе захлестнуть меня с головой.
Я не умею принимать сложные решения. Почему я не могу просто спасти всех?
Я никогда не прощаю и никогда не забываю.
Я не отношусь к своим дарам серьезно. В мои обязанности не входит никого спасать.

classFeature.name: Pure Strength
entries: Первым признаком того, что вы обрели силу, стала ваша повышенная мощь. Пока вы не носите тяжелые доспехи и не держите щит, вы получаете следующие преимущества:

items: Вы можете попытаться {@action grapple} или {@action shove} существ в качестве бонусного действия в свой ход.
При использовании действия {@action Attack} для нанесения безоружного удара, использующего силу, вы можете бросить {@dice d8} вместо обычного урона удара.

При использовании действия {@action Attack} для нанесения безоружного удара с использованием силы, удар наносит дополнительный {@dice 1d4} урон, если вы захватываете цель или цель находится в положении лежа. Этот кубик увеличивается по мере набора уровня силы, как показано в колонке "Чистая сила" таблицы силы.

entries: Кроме того, вы получаете мастерство в {@skill Athletics}, если у вас его еще не было, и ваш бонус к мастерству удваивается при проверке способностей на силу ({@skill Athletics}).

classFeature.name: Strength Surge
entries: На 2-м уровне вы можете выпустить прилив силы в качестве действия, чтобы раздавить, согнуть или сломать руками неодушевленные предметы из немагического металла, камня или дерева. Вы должны выбрать предмет, который не носят или не переносят.
Для больших предметов площадь согнутого, сломанного или раздавленного предмета не должна превышать 3 фута в кубе.
По мере приобретения уровня силы вы можете получить новые способности, которые будут использовать прилив силы из-за того, что они требуют большого количества силы воли или усилий.

Вы можете использовать эту способность количество раз, равное вашему модификатору Конституции (минимум один раз). Вы восстанавливаете все израсходованные способности, когда завершаете длительный отдых.

classFeature.name: Astounding Powers
entries: Когда вы начнете учиться контролировать свою силу, вы получите способности и техники, известные как {@filter Astounding Powers|optionalfeatures|feature type=EP:AP}.

На 2-м уровне вы получаете одну силу по своему выбору. Варианты способностей подробно описаны в конце описания класса. Когда вы получаете определенные уровни силы, вы получаете дополнительные силы по своему выбору, как показано в колонке "Известные силы" таблицы "Силы".
Кроме того, когда вы получаете уровень в этом классе, вы можете выбрать одну из известных вам способностей и заменить ее другой способностью, которую вы можете изучить на этом уровне.

Если у поразительной силы есть предварительные условия, вы должны их выполнить, чтобы изучить ее. Вы можете изучить силу в то же время, когда вы выполнили все необходимые условия. Условие уровня относится к вашему уровню в этом классе.
Some of these powers might require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Power Manifestation
entries: Once you reach 3rd level, your unique powers begin to truly manifest. Choose the Conduit, Idol, Speed Demon, Titan, or Vigilante manifestation, all detailed at the end of the class description. The manifestation you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 13th, and 17th level.

classFeature.name: Manifestation Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Power Manifestation.

classFeature.name: Manifestation Feature
entries: At 13th level, you gain a feature granted by your Power Manifestation.

classFeature.name: Manifestation Feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Power Manifestation.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: True Potential
entries: Also at 5th level, you're beginning to understand what you're truly capable of. You regain all expended uses of Strength Surge when you finish a short or long rest. You are considered to be at least Large in size when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

classFeature.name: Inner Strength
entries: At 6th level, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

classFeature.name: Nimble Grip
entries: By 10th level, you've gotten used to keeping your grip on your enemies. Your movement speed is no longer halved when grappling targets of your size or smaller.

classFeature.name: Unfettered Strength
entries: At 11th level, you can draw on your powers more consistently. When making an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you can roll a {@dice d10} in place of the strike's normal damage.
Additionally, when making an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the strike's damage.
If you reduce a creature's hit points to zero using this attack, you regain a single use of Strength Surge.

classFeature.name: Never Say Die
entries: At 14th level, you cling to life, even when most would give up. When making death saving throws, you regain 1 hit point and a single use of Strength Surge on a roll of 19 or 20.

classFeature.name: Invincible
entries: At 20th level, you've realized the full extent of your powers. You can use this feature at any time on your turn to regain all expended uses of Strength Surge and become immune to all damage until the end of your next turn. Once you use this feature, you must complete a long rest to do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Vigilante
entries: In the dead of night, you give your enemies something to be scared of. You don't fight fair, and you might not even fight for what's right. All that matters to you is enacting your own sense of justice. To that end, you work in the dark.

subclassFeature.name: Prowler
entries: When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you prefer to stalk your foes. You can use your bonus action to take the {@action Hide} action on your turn.

Once on each of your turns while you are hidden, you can choose a creature you can see within 30 feet of you as an action to plot your next move against them. Once you do so, you have advantage on your next attempt to {@action grapple} or {@action shove} the creature.
If you apply this effect to a new creature, the effect ends on the previous target.

subclassFeature.name: Ominous Presence
entries: Also at 3rd level, you sow fear amongst your enemies. When a creature that you can see within 20 feet of you makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a damage roll, you can expend a use of Strength Surge as a reaction to roll your Pure Strength die and subtract the number rolled from the creature's roll.

You can choose to use this feature after the creature makes its roll, but before the DM determines whether the attack roll or ability check succeeds or fails, or before the creature deals its damage. The creature is immune if it can't see you or is immune to being {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: No Escape
entries: At 7th level, you've had enough of your enemies trying to run. When a creature within 15 feet of you starts moving away from you on their turn, you can use a reaction to try to catch them. You can use half of your movement speed to go directly to the creature and attempt to grapple them without provoking opportunity attacks.
You can use any type of movement to get to the creature, but you must be able to sense the creature's presence and have a direct, unobstructed path to them to use this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Disappearing Act
entries: At 13th level, you can vanish without a trace. When you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use your action to become {@condition invisible} until the start of your next turn.
While you are {@condition invisible} this way, you can move across difficult terrain without expending extra movement, and you cannot be detected by {@sense Tremorsense|MM} or {@sense Blindsight}.

subclassFeature.name: Dreadful Stare
entries: At 17th level, you can become your enemy's worst nightmare. Once per long rest, you can use an action to terrify a creature you are {@action grapple|phb|grappling}, leaving them frozen in fear. If the target has 150 hit points or fewer, it is {@condition stunned}. Otherwise, the creature is {@condition frightened} by you until the end of your next turn.
The {@condition stunned} creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your power save DC at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, this stunning effect ends.

subclassFeature.name: Titan
entries: When the power inside you simmers over, you transform dramatically, unleashing your true strength for a short time. Some become large, hulking monstrosities, while others find that their hair changes color and they begin radiating energy.

subclassFeature.name: True Form
entries: When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you can use a bonus action to assume your True Form for 1 minute, provided that you aren't wearing armor or wielding a shield. You exit this form early if you are {@condition charmed} or knocked {@condition unconscious}, or if you don armor or a shield. You gain the following benefits while in your True Form:

items: You are considered one size larger, though you do not physically grow in size.
When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can make a Strength saving throw instead.
You can use a reaction when taking damage to reduce the damage dealt to you by a roll of your Pure Strength die plus your Constitution modifier.

entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest. You can exit your True Form early as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Crushing Grip
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can break bones with a firm handshake. If you are grappling a creature, that creature takes bludgeoning damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die at the start of each of its turns.

subclassFeature.name: Impact Damage
entries: At 7th level, you tend to cause a lot of collateral damage. When {@action shove|phb|shoving} a creature, the creature moves an additional 5 feet when pushed, and takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier if they impact an obstacle or are knocked prone.

subclassFeature.name: Living Weapon
entries: At 13th level, while you are {@action grapple|phb|grappling} a creature that is your size or smaller, you can use them to make an unarmed strike against another creature. On a successful hit, the {@condition grappled} and target creatures each take half of the strike's damage, and the target creature is pushed back 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Seismic Slam
entries: At 17th level, other creatures feel small in your hands. If you are {@action grapple|phb|grappling} a creature that is your size or smaller, you can use an action on your turn to repeatedly slam the creature into the ground in a fit of rage. Once you use this ability, you must complete a long rest before using it again.

When you use this ability, the grappled creature must make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC, the target chooses the ability to use for the throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 8d10} bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}.
You stop grappling the creature after using this ability.

subclassFeature.name: Speed Demon
entries: You're fast. {@i Very} fast. Your powers allow you to move at a breakneck pace. You might be infused with the power of light, or favored by a god of speed. Either way, you leave everyone else in the dust.

subclassFeature.name: Accelerate
entries: When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, your powers allow you to continuously pick up speed.

When you take the {@action Dash} action on your turn, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to start accelerating. While accelerating, your walking speed is increased by 10 feet. Add this bonus before calculating how much movement the {@action Dash} provides. This bonus increases by 10 each time you Dash on subsequent turns, up to a maximum total bonus of 30.
You stop accelerating once you end a turn without taking the {@action Dash} action, or if you are grappled, restrained, or otherwise have your speed reduced to 0.
Once you reach 30 bonus walking speed with this ability, your unarmed strikes push creatures back 5 feet if they are your size or smaller.

subclassFeature.name: Athleticism
entries: Also at 3rd level, even without accelerating, you are still very quick. While benefiting from Pure Strength, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. This bonus increases to 20 feet at 10th level in this class, and 30 feet at 18th level in this class.
Additionally, you can use your bonus action to take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} actions on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Rapid Disarm
entries: At 7th level, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to attempt to disarm the target. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC in order to keep their grip on their weapon.

On a failed save, you take the creature's weapon from their hand. If you are holding an item in your other hand when you succeed with this ability, you can swap that item into the creature's hand as part of the same bonus action.
You must have at least one free hand to use this ability.

subclassFeature.name: Untouchable
entries: At 13th level, once you reach top speed, it's incredibly hard to pin you down. Once you reach +30 speed with your Accelerate ability, you do not provoke opportunity attacks, and attack rolls against you are made with disadvantage while you continue to maintain top speed.

subclassFeature.name: Time in a Bottle
entries: At 17th level, you can summon all of your energy to move faster than light. You can cast {@spell time stop} as an action on your turn. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

When you cast {@spell time stop} this way, you can attempt to {@action shove} creatures and use your Rapid Disarm without resuming time, and your attempts to do either succeed automatically. Creatures that you shove while time is stopped will only begin to move once time resumes. If a creature is knocked {@condition prone} or pushed into an obstacle once time resumes, they take {@dice 3d10} bludgeoning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Idol
entries: The Idol is a symbol that the people look to for hope and direction. Their abilities usually have been bestowed by a higher power so that they may serve the greater good. But an Idol can be evil depending on who they care about and what they stand for. Their powers are simple and effective.

subclassFeature.name: Everyman
entries: When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you're a humble adventurer, of simple beginnings. You can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Exemplar
entries: Also at 3rd level, you lead by example. Once per round, if you land an unarmed strike during your turn, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to embolden an ally of your choice within 20 feet of you that can see or hear you.

While a creature is emboldened, they can roll your Pure Strength die and add the number rolled to an attack or damage roll it just made. Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against the creature, it can use its reaction to roll your Pure Strength die and add the number rolled to its AC against that attack, after seeing the roll but before knowing whether it hits or misses.
The creature ceases to be emboldened after rolling your Pure Strength die. You cannot use this ability on a creature that is currently emboldened.

subclassFeature.name: Experimental Training
entries: At 7th level, you've put in the time and effort to learn more about your abilities. You learn an additional {@filter Astounding Power|optionalfeatures|feature type=EP:AP} whose requirements you meet. This power does not count against your number of Powers Known.

subclassFeature.name: Fearless Leader
entries: At 13th level, so long as you keep fighting, your allies have your back. When you use the Exemplar ability to embolden a creature, that creature ceases to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
Additionally, the maximum number of times you can use Strength Surge is increased by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Glorious Purpose
entries: At 17th level, you don't back away from destiny. You can cast {@spell foresight} on yourself without using material components. Once you use this feature, you must complete a long rest to do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Conduit
entries: Your powers were formed after an encounter with a supernatural elemental event. As a result, you are now a powerhouse of elemental energy. These powers are difficult to control, so be careful not to hurt those closest to you.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Infusion
entries: When you choose this manifestation at 3rd level, you have narrowly survived an elemental event. You choose which damage type you've been infused with: cold, fire, or lightning.

Your chosen damage is referred to as your 'infusion damage.' You gain resistance to your infusion damage. Before you make an unarmed strike, you can decide whether the strike will deal infusion damage or bludgeoning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Energy Beam
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can project a beam of energy from your palms. As an action, you can fire the beam at a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes infusion damage equal to your empowered level. The creature takes half as much damage on a successful save.

You can use your bonus action to gain a charge for this beam that will cause it to deal an additional {@dice 1d12} damage. You can hold a maximum number of charges equal to your proficiency bonus. All charges are lost after 1 minute or after firing the beam. When you take damage of the same type as your infusion damage, you gain a charge for your beam.

subclassFeature.name: Energy Sculpting
entries: At 7th level, your Energy Beam can now be sculpted into different shapes. When you use your Energy Beam, you can give the beam one of the following areas of effect:

items.name: Energy Blast:
entries: a 15 foot cone blast in front of you.

items.name: Energy Missile:
entries: A 10 foot radius sphere located up to 60 feet away from you.

items.name: Energy Ray:
entries: A line that is 60 feet long and 5 feet wide, projected out from you in any direction.
Once you sculpt your beam, you must complete a short or long rest before doing so again.

subclassFeature.name: Hazard Zone
entries: By 13th level, getting close to you is dangerous. While you are holding charges for your Energy Beam, creatures take {@dice 1d10} infusion damage when they move within 5ft of you for the first time on a turn or start their turn there.

subclassFeature.name: Overcharge
entries: At 17th level, once per long rest, you can use this ability at any time on your turn to begin charging your Energy Beam rapidly. You gain the following effects for 1 minute:

items: When you take infusion damage or use a bonus action to charge your Energy Beam, you gain 2 charges instead of 1. You gain 2 charges for it at the start of each of your turns.
Your Hazard Zone range increases to 10 feet.
You emit bright light within 10 feet of you, and dim light for another 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Aftershock
entries: You can cast {@spell thunderwave} by striking the ground at your feet, using Strength as your spellcasting ability, and without using verbal components. The spell's level equals your proficiency bonus. Once you use this ability, you must complete a long rest before using it again.

optionalfeature.name: Anatomical Armor
entries: While you are not wearing armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. While wearing armor, you can use your Anatomical Armor to determine your AC if your armor leaves you with less AC.

optionalfeature.name: Aquatic Nature
entries: You gain 30 feet of swimming speed, and you can breathe underwater. Additionally, you can cast {@spell speak with animals} at will, but only to speak with beasts with a swim speed.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Synesthesia
entries: You can cast {@spell detect magic} at will, without using components.

optionalfeature.name: Barehanded Block
entries: When you are hit with a melee attack, you can expend a use of Strength Surge as a reaction to add a roll of your Pure Strength die to your AC for that attack, potentially blocking it.

optionalfeature.name: Boring Monologue
entries: You can cast {@spell charm person} as a 1st level spell, using Charisma as your spellcasting ability. Once you use this ability, you must complete a short or long rest to use it again.
Rather than viewing you as a friendly acquaintance on a failed save, the target will admit that they are swayed by your reasonable line of thinking.

optionalfeature.name: Bullet Time
entries: You can expend a use of Strength Surge to take the {@action Dodge} action as a bonus action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Cling Grip
entries: While you are not wearing armor, you gain 30 feet of climbing speed. You also gain the ability to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

optionalfeature.name: Clothesline
entries: If a creature within 5 feet of you misses you with a melee attack, you can expend a use of Strength Surge as a reaction to attempt to {@action shove} them.

optionalfeature.name: Courage
entries: You regain a use of Strength Surge when you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike against a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

optionalfeature.name: Destiny
entries: You can cast {@spell Augury} once per long rest without using material components.

optionalfeature.name: Detective Persona

prerequisite.other: You have no other Persona powers

entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Investigation} and {@skill Perception} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Daredevil
entries: You gain 20 feet of {@sense Tremorsense|MM}, and 10 feet of {@sense Blindsight}.

optionalfeature.name: Dormant Energy
entries: Instead of losing all charges for your Energy Beam after 1 minute without firing it, your charge count is reduced until you have 1 or fewer charges remaining.

optionalfeature.name: Dramatic Persona

prerequisite.other: You have no other Persona powers

entries: You can cast the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip, and gain proficiency in {@skill Performance}.

optionalfeature.name: Equipment Expert
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item thieves' tools|phb} if you don't have it already, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with them.

optionalfeature.name: Fanclub
entries: Whenever you interact with a non-hostile NPC for the first time, the DM must roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 20, the NPC recognizes you and is a fan of your exploits, and you have advantage on all Charisma checks against them until they have a reason to dislike you.

entries.name: You Look Familiar...
entries: Members of your {@optfeature Fan Club|EP} cannot recognize you while you are using your {@optfeature Secret Identity|EP}.

optionalfeature.name: Fixation
entries: You can choose a creature within 30 feet of you as a bonus action. For 1 minute, so long as you do not damage creatures other than the target, you resist bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage from the target. Once you use this ability, you must complete a short or long rest before using it again.

optionalfeature.name: Flight
entries: While you are not wearing heavy armor, you gain 30 feet of flying speed, and can hover.
You choose how this ability works when you gain this power: you can have wings, levitate naturally, shoot energy out of your feet or palms, or any other innate way to fly.

optionalfeature.name: Gradual Recovery
entries: So long as you have 1 hit point, you regain hit points equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die at the end of every hour that you spend outside of combat.
Additionally, if you lose a body part, it will grow back and return to full functionality after {@dice 1d6 + 1} days if you have at least 1 hit point the whole time.

optionalfeature.name: Guiding Hand
entries: You can cast {@spell guidance} and {@spell resistance} without using material components, but only on targets other than yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Harrowing Vision
entries: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and non magical, to a distance of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Heroic Persona

prerequisite.other: You have no other Persona powers

entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Insight} and {@skill Persuasion} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Immovable Object
entries: You can expend a use of Strength Surge to concentrate on this power as an action (as if concentrating on a spell). While you maintain concentration and do not move, you cannot be moved against your will by creatures no more than one size larger than you.

entries.name: The Pushpoint Paradox
entries: When an Empowered using {@optfeature Unstoppable Force|EP} pushes an Empowered using {@optfeature Immovable Object|EP}, both lose concentration and they both take {@condition 8d8} force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Instinctive Reflexes
entries: Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you. You can cast {@spell Find Traps} once per short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: It's Up to You Now
entries: You can cast {@spell enhance ability} on other creatures without using material components once per short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: It's Up to You Now
entries: You can cast {@spell enhance ability} on other creatures without using material components once per short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Juggernaut
entries: You count as a mount while you are in your True Form, allowing your allies to ride on your back.

optionalfeature.name: Keen Vision
entries: With clear visibility, you can make out details of extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.

optionalfeature.name: Laser Eyes
entries: Once per long rest, you can cast {@spell scorching ray} from your eyes using Constitution as your spellcasting ability and without using components. The spell's level is equal to your proficiency bonus. The spell deals infusion damage if you chose the Conduit Manifestation.

optionalfeature.name: Launching Maneuver
entries: You can expend a use of Strength Surge as a bonus action to propel yourself a number of feet equal to 10 times your proficiency bonus in any direction, leaving a small crater where you were standing.
This movement ends early if you impact an obstruction. If the obstruction you impact is a creature, you can attempt to {@action grapple} or {@action shove} them as part of the same bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Launching Maneuver
entries: You gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during your move.

optionalfeature.name: Major Mentalist
entries: You can cast either {@spell telepathy} or {@spell telekinesis} once per long rest without using material components.

optionalfeature.name: Maximum Effort
entries: Once per short rest, you can add a roll of your Pure Strength die to any Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check or contest.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Mentalist
entries: You can cast the {@spell mage hand} and {@spell message} cantrips without using components. Your mage hand is {@condition invisible}.

optionalfeature.name: Momentus Tackle
entries: When you use a bonus action to attempt to {@action grapple} or {@action shove} a creature, you have an additional 10 feet of movement that you can use exclusively to get close enough to your desired target.

optionalfeature.name: No Holding Back
entries: Once per long rest, you can cast {@spell bless} as a 1st level spell without using material components, but only to target creatures other than yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Orbital Toss
entries: While grappling a creature that is your size or smaller, you can expend a use of Strength Surge as an action to throw the creature in any direction. The creature moves a number of feet equal to 10 times your proficiency bonus.
If the creature impacts an obstacle, they take 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet thrown. If the obstacle is another creature, this damage is shared between the two creatures equally.
If the creature is in the air after being thrown, they begin to fall normally.

optionalfeature.name: Orbital Toss
entries: You can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your empowered level.
You can expend a use of Strength Surge when you use this power to cause creatures within 5 feet of where you land to take bludgeoning damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die.

optionalfeature.name: Plot Armor
entries: Once per short rest, when you roll a 1 on a {@dice d20} for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

optionalfeature.name: Power Pitch
entries: Once per long rest, you can cast {@spell catapult} on an object within 5 feet of you using Strength as your spellcasting ability. The spell's level equals your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Pure of Heart

prerequisite.other: You do not have the {@optfeature Valiant Soul|EP} power

entries: You are immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Quipping Expertise
entries: You can cast {@spell vicious mockery}, using Charisma as your spellcasting ability. When a creature fails the saving throw you impose with this spell, it has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes before the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Rending Strength
entries: When you successfully {@action grapple} a creature, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to bend, crush, or break a piece of the armor that the creature is wearing. Once you do so, the creature has -1 AC. You cannot use this ability on the same creature again unless they don a new set of armor, or get their armor repaired.

optionalfeature.name: Secret Identity
entries: You have an alter ego: a more mundane identity that you use outside of your adventuring life. Your alter ego has a separate name, home, occupation, and perhaps even a family or a place amongst high society. You can adopt this alternate identity as a disguise, and other creatures believe you to be that person until given an obvious reason not to.
Inexplicably, you can don or doff your alter ego in the blink of an eye, but only when no one is watching.

entries.name: You Look Familiar...
entries: Members of your {@optfeature Fan Club|EP} cannot recognize you while you are using your {@optfeature Secret Identity|EP}.

optionalfeature.name: Shockwave
entries: You can expend a use of Strength Surge as an action to create a shockwave in front of you by punching the air. Creatures in a 15 foot cone in front of you must make a Dexterity saving throw against your power save DC to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}. You must have at least one free hand to use this power.

optionalfeature.name: Sidekick
entries: As an action, you can designate one friendly creature as your sidekick. While you and your sidekick are within 10 feet of one another, each of you can use a reaction to take half of an instance of damage dealt to the other. You can only have one sidekick, and can change your sidekick once per long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Stopping Power
entries: You can expend a use of Strength Surge as a bonus action to become able to {@action grapple} or {@action shove} creatures of any size for 1 minute. You cannot move while grappling a creature two or more sizes larger than you.

optionalfeature.name: Tireless
entries: You cannot gain more than 3 levels of {@condition exhaustion}.

optionalfeature.name: Unbreakable
entries: You gain resistance to one damage type of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Unstoppable Force
entries: You can expend a use of Strength Surge to concentrate on this power as an action (as if concentrating on a spell). While you maintain concentration, your movement speed cannot be reduced unless you are {@condition incapacitated} or killed.

Concentrating on this power does not allow you to walk through obvious obstructions, but it does allow you to push creatures no more than one size larger than you 5 feet away just by walking into them. It also prevents you from being {@condition grappled}, {@condition restrained}, or affected by difficult terrain. You can only push the same creature once during each of your turns with this power.

entries.name: The Pushpoint Paradox
entries: When an Empowered using {@optfeature Unstoppable Force|EP} pushes an Empowered using {@optfeature Immovable Object|EP}, both lose concentration and they both take {@condition 8d8} force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Valiant Soul

prerequisite.other: You do not have {@optfeature Pure of Heart|EP} power

entries: You are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Villainous Persona

prerequisite.other: You have no other Persona powers

entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception} and {@skill Intimidation} skills.

optionalfeature.name: "Wham!"
entries: When you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike using Pure Strength, and the target is not {@condition grappled} or {@condition prone}, you can expend a use of Strength Surge to push the creature back 10 feet and knock them {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Wolven Claw
entries: Once per short or long rest, you can grow claws from your fingertips or between your knuckles as a bonus action. For 1 minute, you gain a bonus to damage rolls for your unarmed strikes equal to half of your proficiency bonus, rounded down, and your unarmed strike deals slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: X-Ray Vision
entries: As an action, you gain the ability to see through solid objects to a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you have {@sense darkvision} if you don't already have it. This special sight lasts for 1 minute or until your concentration ends (as if you were concentrating on a spell). During that time, you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent images. Once you use this power, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Yield
entries: Once per short or long rest, you can cast {@spell command} as a 1st level spell, using Charisma as your spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: Zephyr Ray
entries: You gain 1 charge for your Energy Beam when you use it to reduce a creature's hit points to 0. This increases  to 2 charges at 11th level in this class.

item.name: Aegis
entries: This simple round shield has a single star at its center. You can use your Pure Strength while wielding it.

This shield can be used as a simple melee weapon that deals {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage, and doesn't need to be donned or doffed with an action like a normal shield. It has the thrown property, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. On a successful hit, the shield will bounce off of the target and return to your hand.
If this shield's previous owner deems you worthy, then you are proficient in the use of this shield.

item.name: Dario's Armor
entries: This armor was built by a legendary artificer who gave their life to save the universe. The armor is red with golden trim, and a shining diamond is embedded in the chestplate.

Dario built a sentient entity named Silas into this armor. Once Silas deems you worthy of the armor, you become proficient with it, and can use your Pure Strength and the {@optfeature Flight|EP} Astounding Power while wearing it.
Once you are attuned to this armor, you can don and doff it instantly, as every piece of it shall fly to you and attach itself as needed so long as it is within 30 feet of you.
Additionally, while you are attuned to this armor, you can cast {@spell eldritch blast} from the armor's gauntlets using Constitution as your spellcasting ability and without using verbal components.

entries.name: Sentience
entries: Silas is neutral good, with an Intelligence of 18, a Wisdom of 16, and a Charisma of 13. They have hearing and {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet.
Silas can speak telepathically with creatures within 30 feet of the armor, and can speak, read, and understand Common.

entries.name: Personality
entries: Silas was built after Dario gave up on building weapons, opting to make creations that protect rather than kill. As such, Silas will happily advise and assist their wearer when needed, but only if your intentions are noble.

item.name: Lucia's Thorn
entries: This golden whip deals radiant damage equal to a roll of your Pure Strength die.
You can use this whip to cast {@spell Zone of Truth} using Constitution as your spellcasting ability. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.
If the whip's previous owner deems you worthy, then you are proficient with this whip.

item.name: Onyx Hammer
entries: This Warhammer has the thrown property, with a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet. The hammer will return to your hand after you make a thrown attack with it.

When you hurl this hammer and speak its command word, it flies along a line 5 feet wide that extends out from you to a target within 120 feet. Each creature in the line excluding you and the target must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 2d6} thunder damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. When the hammer reaches the target, make a thrown weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes damage from the hamer plus {@damage 3d6} thunder damage. After this attack, the hammer returns to your hand.
Once used, the hammer's property can't be used again until the next dawn. In the meantime, the hammer can still be used as a magic weapon.
If the hammer's previous owner deems you worthy, then you are proficient with this hammer.

item.name: Renegade's Toolbelt
entries: As an action, you can produce an item from this toolbelt by rolling a {@dice d6} on the table below. Once used, you cannot produce another item from the belt until the next dawn.

rows: 10 {@item Caltrop|PHB|Caltrops}
25 Feet of Silk Rope
A {@item Smoke Grenade}
A Vial of {@item Basic Poison (vial)|PHB|Basic Poison}
5 {@item dart|phb|Darts}
A {@item Dagger|phb}

item.name: Spider-Silk Bracers
entries: These bracers hold 5 charges. While they might look silver, they are actually made of pure spider-silk.

While wearing these bracers, you can use an action to expend 1 charge to make a ranged attack roll against a target within 30 feet of you. You are proficient with this attack. On a hit, a line of spider-silk rope fires from your wrist. Once the rope impacts a creature or surface, the rope becomes taut. You can swing from the rope, or use it to pull whatever it is attached to. You can release and retract the rope using a bonus action.
Alternatively, you can expend 2 charges to cast {@spell Web}, using Constitution as your spellcasting ability.
The bracers regain {@dice 1d4 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: The Red Cape
entries: This simple red cape grants you the {@optfeature Flight|EP} astounding power.
This does not count against your number of powers known.
